summary:
Ancient Rome was a powerful civilization that lasted from around 753 BC to the 5th century AD. It started as a small city in Italy and grew to rule a huge empire, including most of Europe, North Africa, and the Middle East. Rome had a big impact on the world, influencing language, culture, law, and politics.

The Romans were known for their strong military and clever government. They built impressive structures like aqueducts and roads, and their architecture and art are still famous today. Rome's legacy can be seen in many modern countries' governments, like the United States and France.
title: Ancient Rome
